Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:vP8So.abstract: true if this engine is connected. Connected means that the initial poll connect has succeeded.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:vP8So.abstract: The connect parameters sent during a connect.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:vP8So.name: extraHeaders
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:vP8So.abstract: A dictionary of extra http headers that will be set during connection.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:vP8So.name: fastUpgrade
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:vP8So.abstract: When true, the engine is in the process of switching to WebSockets.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:vP8So.name: forcePolling
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:vP8So.abstract: When true, the engine will only use HTTP long-polling as a transport.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:vP8So.abstract: When true, the engine will only use WebSockets as a transport.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:vP8So.abstract: If true, the engine is currently in HTTP long-polling mode.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:vP8So.abstract: If true, the engine is currently seeing whether it can upgrade to WebSockets.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:FP8So.abstract: Called to switch from HTTP long-polling to WebSockets. After calling this method the engine will be in

Protocols/SocketEnginePollable.html#/s:v.abstract: true if there is an outstanding poll. Trying to poll before the first is done will cause socket.io to

Protocols/SocketEnginePollable.html#/s:v.abstract: true if there is an outstanding post. Trying to post before the first is done will cause socket.io to

Protocols/SocketEnginePollable.html#/s:F.abstract: Sends an engine.io message through the polling transport.

Protocols/SocketEnginePollable.html.abstract: Protocol that is used to implement socket.io polling support

Protocols/SocketLogger.html.abstract: Represents a class will log client events.

Protocols/SocketEngineClient.html.abstract: Declares that a type will be a delegate to an engine.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.name: connectParams
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: A dictionary of GET parameters that will be included in the connect url.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.name: cookies
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: An array of cookies that will be sent during the initial connection.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.name: doubleEncodeUTF8
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: Deprecated

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.name: extraHeaders
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: Any extra HTTP headers that should be sent during the initial connection.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.name: forceNew
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: If passed true, will cause the client to always create a new engine. Useful for debugging,

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.name: forcePolling
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: If passed true, the only transport that will be used will be HTTP long-polling.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.name: forceWebsockets
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: If passed true, the only transport that will be used will be WebSockets.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.name: handleQueue
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: The queue that all interaction with the client should occur on. This is the queue that event handlers are

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.name: log
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: If passed true, the client will log debug information. This should be turned off in production code.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.name: logger
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: Used to pass in a custom logger.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.name: nsp
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: The namespace that this client should connect to. Can be changed during use using the joinNamespace

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.name: path
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: A custom path to socket.io. Only use this if the socket.io server is configured to look for this path.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.name: reconnects
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: If passed false, the client will not reconnect when it loses connection. Useful if you want full control

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.name: reconnectAttempts
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: The number of times to try and reconnect before giving up. Pass -1 to never give up.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.name: reconnectWait
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: The number of seconds to wait before reconnect attempts.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.name: secure
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: Set true if your server is using secure transports.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.name: security
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: Allows you to set which certs are valid. Useful for SSL pinning.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.name: selfSigned
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: If you’re using a self-signed set. Only use for development.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.name: sessionDelegate
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: Sets an NSURLSessionDelegate for the underlying engine. Useful if you need to handle self-signed certs.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.name: voipEnabled
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: If passed true, the WebSocket transport will try and use voip logic to keep network connections open in

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:ZFO8S.abstract: Compares whether two options are the same.

Enums/SocketIOClientStatus.html#/s:FO8So.name: notConnected
Enums/SocketIOClientStatus.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: The client has never been connected. Or the client has been reset.

Enums/SocketIOClientStatus.html#/s:FO8So.name: disconnected
Enums/SocketIOClientStatus.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: The client was once connected, but not anymore.

Enums/SocketIOClientStatus.html#/s:FO8So.name: connecting
Enums/SocketIOClientStatus.html#/s:FO8So.abstract: The client is in the process of connecting.

Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:FO8Socke.name: connect
Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:FO8Socke.abstract: Emitted when the client connects. This is also called on a successful reconnection.

Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:FO8Socke.name: disconnect
Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:FO8Socke.abstract: Called when the socket has disconnected and will not attempt to try to reconnect.

Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:FO8Socke.name: reconnect
Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:FO8Socke.abstract: Called when the client begins the reconnection process.

Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:FO8Socke.name: reconnectAttempt
Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:FO8Socke.abstract: Called each time the client tries to reconnect to the server.

Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:FO8Socke.name: statusChange
Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:FO8Socke.abstract: Called every time there is a change in the client’s status.

Enums/SocketClientEvent.html.name: SocketClientEvent
Enums/SocketClientEvent.html.abstract: The set of events that are generated by the client.

Enums/SocketEnginePacketType.html.name: SocketEnginePacketType
Enums/SocketEnginePacketType.html.abstract: Represents the type of engine.io packet types.

Classes/SocketClientManager.html#/s:FC8S.name: removeSocket(withLabel:)
Classes/SocketClientManager.html#/s:FC8S.abstract: Removes a socket by a given name.

Classes/SocketClientManager.html#/s:FC8S.name: removeSockets()
Classes/SocketClientManager.html#/s:FC8S.abstract: Removes all the sockets in the manager.

Classes/WebSocket.html#/s:vC8SocketIO9We.name: delegate
Classes/WebSocket.html#/s:vC8SocketIO9We.abstract: Responds to callback about new messages coming in over the WebSocket

Classes/WebSocket.html#/s:vC8SocketIO9We.name: pongDelegate
Classes/WebSocket.html#/s:vC8SocketIO9We.abstract: Receives a callback for each pong message recived.

Classes/WebSocket.html#/s:FC8SocketIO9We.name: connect()
Classes/WebSocket.html#/s:FC8SocketIO9We.abstract: Connect to the WebSocket server on a background thread.

Classes/WebSocket.html#/s:FC8SocketIO9We.name: disconnect(forceTimeout:closeCode:)
Classes/WebSocket.html#/s:FC8SocketIO9We.abstract: Disconnect from the server. I send a Close control frame to the server, then expect the server to respond with a Close control frame and close the socket from its end. I notify my delegate once the socket has been closed.

Classes/WebSocket.html#/s:FC8SocketIO9We.name: write(string:completion:)
Classes/WebSocket.html#/s:FC8SocketIO9We.abstract: Write a string to the websocket. This sends it as a text frame.

Classes/WebSocket.html#/s:FC8SocketIO9We.name: write(data:completion:)
Classes/WebSocket.html#/s:FC8SocketIO9We.abstract: Write binary data to the websocket. This sends it as a binary frame.

Classes/WebSocket.html#/s:FC8SocketIO9We.name: write(ping:completion:)
Classes/WebSocket.html#/s:FC8SocketIO9We.abstract: Write a ping to the websocket. This sends it as a control frame.

Classes/WebSocket.html#/s:FC8SocketIO9We.name: stream(_:handle:)
Classes/WebSocket.html#/s:FC8SocketIO9We.abstract: Delegate for the stream methods. Processes incoming bytes

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:vC8Socket.name: socketURL
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:vC8Socket.abstract: The URL of the socket.io server. This is set in the initializer.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:vC8Socket.name: forceNew
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:vC8Socket.abstract: If true then every time connect is called, a new engine will be created.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:vC8Socket.name: handleQueue
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:vC8Socket.abstract: The queue that all interaction with the client should occur on. This is the queue that event handlers are

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:vC8Socket.abstract: If true, this client will try and reconnect on any disconnects.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:vC8Socket.name: reconnectWait
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:vC8Socket.abstract: The number of seconds to wait before attempting to reconnect.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:FC8Socket.abstract: Type safe way to create a new SocketIOClient. opts can be omitted.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:FC8Socket.abstract: Not so type safe way to create a SocketIOClient, meant for Objective-C compatiblity.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:FC8Socket.name: connect()
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:FC8Socket.abstract: Connect to the server.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:FC8Socket.name: connect(timeoutAfter:withHandler:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:FC8Socket.abstract: Connect to the server. If we aren’t connected after timeoutAfter seconds, then withHandler is called.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:FC8Socket.name: disconnect()
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:FC8Socket.abstract: Disconnects the socket.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:FC8Socket.abstract: Same as emit, but meant for Objective-C

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:FC8Socket.abstract: Same as emitWithAck, but for Objective-C

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:FC8Socket.abstract: Called when the engine errors.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:FC8Socket.name: engineDidOpen(reason:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:FC8Socket.abstract: Called when the engine opens.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:FC8Socket.abstract: Joins namespace.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:FC8Socket.abstract: Removes handler(s) based on an event name.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:FC8Socket.abstract: Removes a handler with the specified UUID gotten from an on or once

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:FC8Socket.abstract: Adds a handler for an event.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:FC8Socket.abstract: Tries to reconnect to the server.

Global Variables.html.name: Global Variables
Global Variables.html.abstract: The following global variables are available globally.
